etymology.description: 发(發) (fā, "to send out; to emit") refers to the idea of expressing or emanating something, often used with an action projection. 呆(呆) (dāi, "dazed; dumb") describes a state of being stunned or unresponsive, often with a lack of awareness.
etymology.interpretation: The combination 发呆(發呆) (fādāi, "be in a daze") captures the state of mind in which one seems to emit or project a lack of awareness, appearing mentally absent or in a reverie.

parts.english: to send out; to emit; to issue; to develop

examples.chinese: 他正在发呆(他正在發呆)。
听到这消息时(聽到這消息時)，他发呆了(他發呆了)。
examples.pinyin: Tīng dào zhè xiāoxī shí, tā fādāile.
examples.english: When he heard the news, he was in a daze.

examples.chinese: 工作太累时发呆(工作太累時發呆)，让他错过了重要的会议(讓他錯過了重要的會議)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngzuò tài lèi shí fādāi, ràng tā cuòguòle zhòngyào de huìyì.
examples.english: Being in a daze from too much work made him miss an important meeting.
